doc.after: A language family is a group of languages related through descent from a common ancestor called the proto language of that family The term family reflects the tree model of language origination in historical linguistics which makes use of a metaphor comparing languages to people in a biological family tree or in a subsequent modification to species in a phylogenetic tree of evolutionary taxonomy No actual biological relationship between speakers is implied by the metaphor
